de.javasoft.swing
Class JYComboBox

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JComboBox
                  de.javasoft.swing.JYComboBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListDataListener
public class JYComboBox
extends javax.swing.JComboBox

Extended comboBox with the ability to set a custom popup component. The size of the popup window can be predefined and/or marked as resizable. In case that another comboBox is required on the popup, the component type has to be JYComboBox - other comboBox types (like JComboBox) are properly not supported.

Version:
1.01, 08.09.2010
See Also:
Serialized Form

setPopupWidth

public void setPopupWidth(int width)
Setter for the popup width. A value <= 0 means that the popup size is calculated by the comboBox itself.

Parameters:
width - The preferred popup width.
See Also:
getPopupWidth(), setPopupHeight(int), setPopupResizable(boolean)

setPopupResizable

public void setPopupResizable(boolean resizable)
Adds a resize handle to the popup to make the popup resizable by user. By default a popup is not resizable.

Parameters:
resizable - True means popup is resizable.
See Also:
isPopupResizable(), setPopupSizeRestorable(boolean)

isPopupResizable

public boolean isPopupResizable()
Getter for popup resize property.

Returns:
True menas popup is resizable.
See Also:
setPopupResizable(boolean)

setPopupSizeRestorable

public void setPopupSizeRestorable(boolean restorable)
When popup sie is restorable and a popup is resizable, a popup will be reopened with the last used size. If set to false or if popup is displayed first time, the default popup size is used. In case that a popup width or popup height is specified the specified values will be used as initial popup size. The property is false by default.

Parameters:
restorable - True means popup size is restorable.
See Also:
setPopupResizable(boolean), setPopupWidth(int), setPopupHeight(int)

isPopupSizeRestorable

public boolean isPopupSizeRestorable()
Getter for the popupSizeRestorable property.

Returns:
True means popupSize is restorable.
See Also:
setPopupSizeRestorable(boolean)

setPopupComponent

public void setPopupComponent(javax.swing.JComponent c)
Sets child component of the popup window. When a child component is set the ComboBox can hold a single item only. The item has to be set by setItem(Object).

Parameters:
c - The component which will be popped up.
See Also:
getPopupComponent(), setItem(Object)

getPopupComponent

public javax.swing.JComponent getPopupComponent()
Getter for the child component of the popup window.

Returns:
The popup component.
See Also:
setPopupComponent(JComponent), setItem(Object)

setItem

public void setItem(java.lang.Object item)
Setter for the current ComboBox item. The method is intended to be used when a custom popup child component is set. In this case the ComboBox can hold a single item only.

Parameters:
item - The new comboBox item.
See Also:
getItem(), setPopupComponent(JComponent)

getItem

public java.lang.Object getItem()
Getter for the currently set item.

Returns:
The ComboBox item.
See Also:
setItem(Object), setPopupComponent(JComponent)

cancelPopup

public void cancelPopup()
Closes and cancels the popup window. In attached popupMenuListeners the popupMenuCanceled method will be called.
